title: Privacy policy
content: Here is the general data protection statement of the demonstration version of the AI Assessment Tool created and made available by the FPS BOSA and AI4Belgium ("We"). At the bottom of this statement, you will find an overview of the specific data protection statements established by the FPS BOSA.
<title>1. Protection of your personal data</title>

When you identify and connect to the AI Assessment Tool site (ai4belgium.be), we process personal data. We consider your privacy to be extremely important and therefore want to inform you as well as possible.
This privacy statement explains how we collect, use and protect your personal data. We also explain what your rights are and how you can exercise them.

This privacy statement is published by the FPS BOSA and AI4Belgium, whose registered office is located at Boulevard Simon Bolivar 30, bte 1 (WTC III), 1000 Brussels, and whose company number is 0671.516.647.
If you have any questions about your personal data or the privacy statement, you can contact us via (see contact details below).
Our policy on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of personal data is based on the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679.
<title>2. For what purposes do we process your personal data?</title>

In order to allow you to access the demonstration version of the AI Assessment Tool, you must identify yourself on our site. In this context, we only process the data necessary to create your account on the basis of your explicit authorization in order to allow you to access the demonstration version.
<title>3. What personal data do we process?</title>
We only process identification data: login and password. You can find more information about these categories on the following website: https://gdpr.belgium.be.
<title>4. With whom do we share your data?</title>
The data we process about you is treated confidentially.

The FPS BOSA sometimes uses service providers who act as subcontractors and who, in this capacity, must comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). The FPS BOSA provides in its relationship with the subcontractor the necessary provisions to protect personal data. This service provider may not use the data for purposes other than those of the FPS BOSA.
<title>5. How long are your data kept?</title>

The data processed on the basis of your authorization is kept for the time indicated at the time of registration or until your authorization is withdrawn, a period of 60 days after which they will be deleted.
<title>6. How to apply your rights under the GDPR?</title>
If you wish to make a request, ask a question or submit a concern about how we use your personal data, please contact our Data Protection Officer ("DPO"):
DPO - FPS BOSA: Boulevard Simon Bolivar 30, bte 1. 1000 Brussels dpo@bosa.fgov.be.

If you contact us to exercise your rights, we will respond to you within 1 month. Exceptionally, this may take longer (up to a total of 3 months), but we will inform you within one month. The possibility of exercising your rights depends on the processing and the legal basis.

Make sure that the right you want to exercise and the way you want to receive the information (for example by e-mail, by mail, verbally, ...) are always clear. Please note that in some cases, we may need more information. We want to make sure we are helping the right person.
<titleSub>Right of access</titleSub>

You have the right to ask us about the personal data we hold about you. We can give you a free copy, but this is not possible for all documents. We want to respect the rights and freedoms of others first and foremost.
<titleSub>Right of rectification</titleSub>

Do you think your data is not correct or up to date? You have the right to ask us to correct it. To the extent that this does not conflict with a legal obligation or with the public interest, your request will be granted and processed.
<titleSub>Right to object</titleSub>

You have the right to ask us to stop processing your personal data. To the extent that this does not conflict with a legal obligation or with the public interest, your request will be granted and processed.
<titleSub>Right to restrict processing</titleSub>

You can ask us to restrict the processing of your personal data, for example when we are checking the accuracy of your personal data. To the extent that this does not conflict with a legal obligation or with the public interest, your request will be granted and processed.
<titleSub>Right to be forgotten or to be deleted</titleSub>
You have the right to ask us to destroy your personal data. However, if the law requires us to keep certain personal data, we may not be able to respond to this request.
<titleSub>Right to withdraw your consent</titleSub>
In the case of processing of personal data based on your consent, you can withdraw this consent.
If you consider it necessary, you can file a complaint with: the Data Protection Authority (DPA), rue de la Presse 35, 1000 Brussels. https://www.autoriteprotectiondonnees.be/
<title>7. What do we do to prevent misuse or unauthorized access?</title>

The FPS BOSA has put in place a number of electronic and administrative procedures as well as hardware facilities. It regularly re-evaluates and updates them in order to protect data against unauthorized access, to ensure security and to ensure that the information collected is used correctly to perform the desired processing.

FPS BOSA staff who have access to information that allows the identification of individuals are required to protect this information in accordance with this personal data protection statement. In particular, staff must refrain from using this information for purposes other than those for which it is processed.
If you notice an incident or have a complaint about it, you can contact: privacyincident@bosa.fgov.be ou dpd@bosa.fgov.be.
<title>8. Cookies</title>

When you visit the website, the FPS BOSA records your IP address, your browser, your operating system, the external service that transferred you to this service, as well as the date and time at which you consulted each page. This information is collected only for statistical purposes and in order to continue to improve the website. The data collected in this way is in no way linked to personal data.
If other data were to be collected on certain FPS BOSA web pages, this would be indicated.
<titleSub>A cookie, what is it?</titleSub>
A cookie is a small text file that can be stored on your computer when you visit websites.

Information is stored in a text file, such as your choice of language for a website. When you visit the website again later, this cookie is sent back to the website in question. In this way, the website recognizes your browser and can, for example, remember your choice of language.

Cookies generally also have an expiration date. Some cookies are automatically deleted when you close your browser (these are called session cookies), while others remain on your computer for longer, sometimes even until you delete them manually (these are called permanent cookies).

To manage the content of its website, the FPS BOSA places essential and functional cookies. These cookies are necessary for the proper functioning of this website. It is not possible to refuse these cookies if you want to visit our website.

The FPS BOSA also uses "MATOMO" for analytical purposes. This analysis tool measures visits (traffic) to the website. To collect additional information useful for this purpose, this analysis tool places cookies. This allows us to know, for example, how many times a particular page has been read. We use this information only to improve the content of our website or as a basis for a new campaign on a particular subject of great interest.
For the use of cookies for analytical purposes, your prior consent is required. If you do not give your consent, only limited statistics on visitors will be collected without cookies being placed.

<titleSub>How to see which cookies are installed on my device and how to delete them?</titleSub>
If you want to know which cookies have been placed on your device or if you want to delete them, you can use a setting in your browser. The links below explain how to do this.
Firefox: https://support.mozilla.org/fr/kb/effacer-les-cookies-pour-supprimer-les-information
Firefox (mobile) : https://support.mozilla.org/fr/kb/effacer-les-cookies-pour-supprimer-les-information

Are you using another browser? Check if the procedure for your browser is included on the site www.allaboutcookies.org (link is external). This website is only available in English.
